â
On July 11, 2010, Harris-Moore was captured just before dawn at [[Harbour Island, Bahamas]].<ref name="SMH20100712">{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/world/barefoot-bandit-caught-in-bahamas-20100711-105s2.html?autostart=1/|title=Barefoot Bandit caught in Bahamas|date=July 12, 2010|accessdate=July 12, 2010|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|agency=[[Fairfax Media]]}}</ref> Local officers picked up his trail in [[Eleuthera]] after recovering a 44 foot (13 metre) power boat stolen from a marina on [[Great Abaco]]. A police official said the suspect attempted to flee, but police shot out the engine on his boat.<ref name="AP-20100711">{{cite news|authors=McCartney, Juan; Melia, Mike|title='Barefoot Bandit' nabbed after 2 years as fugitive|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5g3ng0HuCqAC4S1vDdZDuEso6S73QD9GT6I100|accessdate=July 12, 2010|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=July 11, 2010}}</ref> Before being arrested, Harris-Moore threw his portable computer into the water and put a gun to his head, but the police talked him out of killing himself.<ref name="CNN-20100713">{{cite news|last=Hayes|first=Ashley|title='Barefoot bandit' pleads guilty in the Bahamas|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2010/CRIME/07/13/bahamas.barefoot.bandit/|accessdate=July 13, 2010|publisher=CNN|date=July 13, 2010}}</ref> He told the police that he intended to go to [[Cuba]] to throw authorities off his trail and proceed to the [[Turks and Caicos Islands]].<ref name="AP-20100714">{{cite news|last=Anderson|first=Curt|title=Accused 'Barefoot Bandit' has US court appearance|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hu6i6UTxAdDNf5f_TEtgSI9ewLGgD9GV0NFG1|agency=[[Associated Press]]|accessdate=July 14, 2010|date=July 14, 2010}}</ref> His mother had hoped that he would flee to a country that did not have an [[extradition]] [[List of United States extradition treaties|treaty with the United States]].<ref name="AP-20100711" />
+
On July 11, 2010, Harris-Moore was captured just before dawn at [[Harbour Island, Bahamas]].<ref name="SMH20100712">{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/world/barefoot-bandit-caught-in-bahamas-20100711-105s2.html?autostart=1/|title=Barefoot Bandit caught in Bahamas|date=July 12, 2010|accessdate=July 12, 2010|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|agency=[[Fairfax Media]]}}</ref> Local officers picked up his trail in [[Eleuthera]] after recovering a 44 foot (13 meter) power boat stolen from a marina on [[Great Abaco]]. A police official said the suspect attempted to flee, but police shot out the engine on his boat.<ref name="AP-20100711">{{cite news|authors=McCartney, Juan; Melia, Mike|title='Barefoot Bandit' nabbed after 2 years as fugitive|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5g3ng0HuCqAC4S1vDdZDuEso6S73QD9GT6I100|accessdate=July 12, 2010|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=July 11, 2010}}</ref> Before being arrested, Harris-Moore threw his portable computer into the water and put a gun to his head, but the police talked him out of killing himself.<ref name="CNN-20100713">{{cite news|last=Hayes|first=Ashley|title='Barefoot bandit' pleads guilty in the Bahamas|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2010/CRIME/07/13/bahamas.barefoot.bandit/|accessdate=July 13, 2010|publisher=CNN|date=July 13, 2010}}</ref> He told the police that he intended to go to [[Cuba]] to throw authorities off his trail and proceed to the [[Turks and Caicos Islands]].<ref name="AP-20100714">{{cite news|last=Anderson|first=Curt|title=Accused 'Barefoot Bandit' has US court appearance|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hu6i6UTxAdDNf5f_TEtgSI9ewLGgD9GV0NFG1|agency=[[Associated Press]]|accessdate=July 14, 2010|date=July 14, 2010}}</ref> His mother had hoped that he would flee to a country that did not have an [[extradition]] [[List of United States extradition treaties|treaty with the United States]].<ref name="AP-20100711" />
